result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmond L Dantzler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Desmond L Dantzler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Desmond L Dantzler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay a fine of $250.00 on or before 02-16-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.

Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees on or before 02-16-2016. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept. **COURT WAIVED THE DOMESTIC VIOLENCE SURCHARGE**. 
Defendant required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
***Restitution set at ZERO.***

with credit for 2 days.  TIME SERVED.

**COURT WILL CONSIDER EXPUNGEMENT IF AND WHEN DEFENDANT SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETES THE COURT ORDERED CONDITIONS**.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmond L Dantzler

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $1,068.00 entered as ordered by the court on 01/07/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 06/01/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.
Court will consider expungement if and when defendant successfully completes the court ordered conditions.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:   COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 2 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days TIME SERVED.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees on or before 02-16-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Court WAIVED the Domestic Violence Surcharge.
*  Pay a fine of $250.00 on or before 02-16-2016.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Restitution set at ZERO.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimens (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Court will consider expungement if and when Defendant successfully completes the court ordered conditions.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

BRANCH 7 (McADAMS)  FOR  BRANCH 24  (PROTASIEWICZ)
Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean Marie Kies.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean Marie Kies.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. First call- parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Case spun to branch 07 for Jury Trial.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean Marie Kies.  Jaclyn Schwartz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 12/16/15 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case recalled.  For reasons stated on the record, Court ruled the 911 call is admissable.  Court granted the request for adjournment.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for jury trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 10/07/15 in Branch 40.  State needs to get the mirandized statements to the defense.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Jean M. Kies.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial conference.  Parties are still in negotiations and would like another date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in ourt.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Jean Kies as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Kies accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 9/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KMV (3/25/91) AND OMV (12/18/93).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Desmond L Dantzler in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DALLET.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch *  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
